name: Reindeer Bar
description: A well-known bar in the town of Cassandra and the location of THE SECOND MURDER CASE on December 22, 2003—exactly one year after the first murder at Paradil Grand Hotel. The bar has two floors: an open hall on the ground floor and surrounding private booths on the second floor. It is under the protection of local organized crime, and its surveillance system contains blind spots known only to a few insiders.

snapshot.name: Reindeer Bar (Post-Incident)
snapshot.location: A two-story bar in the town of Cassandra
snapshot.description: The crime scene has already been cleaned, and the owners are preparing to reopen the bar. Despite this, the atmosphere remains tense and oppressive. This is THE SECOND MURDER CASE, occurring exactly one year after the first case at Paradil Grand Hotel. The victim was Aberforth Locefern (also known as Jenny Florence), a 21-year-old Black girl who was shot (.357 caliber) and stabbed with a folding knife in the restroom. Several suspects have been brought back here by the police for a second round of questioning. At night, regular patrons still come in for drinks.

snapshot.keeperNotes: Reindeer Bar is the site of THE SECOND MURDER CASE (December 22, 2003), occurring exactly one year after the first case at Paradil Grand Hotel. CRITICALLY DISTINCT: The second victim is Aberforth Locefern (Jenny Florence), 21 years old, killed by gunshot (.357 caliber) and stabbed with a folding knife in the restroom. This is COMPLETELY DIFFERENT from the first case (19-year-old girl, frozen in ice in hotel freezer). Emphasize that these are TWO SEPARATE CASES with TWO DIFFERENT BODIES, exactly one year apart. Multiple suspects, conflicting testimonies, and the surveillance blind spots allow the Keeper to apply pressure and escalate tension.
